subt: For 10 of the available 100 marks, N ≤ 10. For an additional 20 marks, N ≤ 100. For the remaining 70 marks, N ≤ 500.
genr:
import random

N = random.randint(3, [10, 100, 500][int(input())])

print(N)

grid = [[random.choice(".LS") for _ in range(N)] for _ in range(N)]

for _ in range(random.randint(N, max(N, N ** 2 // 4))):
    x = random.randint(1, N - 2)
    y = random.randint(1, N - 2)
    grid[x][y] = "S"
    grid[x - 1][y] = grid[x + 1][y] = grid[x][y - 1] = grid[x][y + 1] = "L"

print("\n".join(map("".join, grid)))
desc: Patrick was walking through a field when he saw a four leaf clover! Looking around, he wondered how many more four-leaf clovers there were in the field. Your task is to help him count the number of four-leaf clovers in the field!
outp: The output will consist of a single integer, the number of four-leaf clovers in the field. A four-leaf clover is defined as a stem with exactly four adjacent leaves. Two squares are adjacent if they share an edge.
inpt: The first line will contain a single integer N. N lines will follow, each containing N characters which are either ., L, or S, with those representing grass, a leaf, or a stem, respectively.
title: Four Leaf Clovers!
